alert.note: Alert for Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley; Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 1:57PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A shower producing small hail will impact portions of west central Monterey County through 230 PM PDT... At 156 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a shower producing small hail over Pico Blanco Campground, or near Big Sur Village, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Lightning will be possible with this shower. Locations impacted include... Big Sur Village, Carmel Valley Village, Andrew Molera State Park, San Clemente Dam, Cachagua Near The Los Padres Dam and Pico Blanco Campground. This includes Highway 1 between Mile Markers 44 and 54, and near Mile Marker 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley; Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
